documentType: email correspondence with attached news article and medical/police forms
summary: This document contains a 2019 email from attorney Ira S. Sacks making a settlement offer on behalf of clients Mr. Honig and Mrs. Wasserman, referencing a case against Abby Leigh. Attached are a 1993 pediatric trauma flow sheet, a 1993 police report form, and a 1995 news article detailing a criminal investigation into the handling of a child sex abuse case involving Andres Sanchez, his wife Carmen Sanchez, and Hillsborough State Attorney Harry Lee Coe III.

persons.name: Ira S. Sacks
persons.context: Author of the 2019 email, offering $150,000 to resolve a matter on behalf of Mr. Honig and Mrs. Wasserman and suggesting Mr. Honig could provide valuable testimony in a case against Abby Leigh.

persons.name: Mr. Honig
persons.context: Client referenced in the 2019 email settlement offer; Sacks is authorized by him and Mrs. Wasserman. Sacks suggests he could provide valuable testimony in a case against Abby Leigh.

persons.name: Mrs. Wasserman
persons.context: Client referenced in the 2019 email settlement offer; Sacks is authorized by her and Mr. Honig.

persons.name: Abby Leigh
persons.context: Mentioned in the 2019 email as the subject of a case that Mr. Honig might provide testimony against.

persons.name: Lawton Chiles
persons.context: Ordered a criminal investigation into the handling of the Andres Sanchez child molestation case in 1995.

persons.name: Steve Alexander
persons.context: Assigned by Governor Chiles to investigate the handling of the Sanchez case. He wrote to Chiles about political pressure and lackadaisical investigation.

persons.name: Andres Sanchez
persons.context: Charged in 1995 with seven counts of sexual battery against his niece between 1987 and 1993.

persons.name: Carmen Sanchez
persons.role: Wife of Andres Sanchez, Democratic activist
persons.context: Married to Andres Sanchez. A Democratic activist and staunch supporter of State Attorney Harry Lee Coe III. Allegedly pressured the victim to recant.

persons.name: Harry Lee Coe III
persons.context: State Attorney whose office initially received the Sanchez case. His friendship with Carmen Sanchez led to a conflict, causing him to request a new prosecutor. He denies allegations of political favoritism.

persons.name: Valentine Munoz
persons.context: The guidance counselor at Claywell Elementary School to whom the victim first reported abuse in 1987. He denied a confrontation meeting took place.

persons.name: Steve Cole
persons.context: Stated Tampa police detectives handled the Sanchez investigation properly and welcomed a review.

persons.name: Tom Jones
persons.context: Said accusations of political overtones by the agency (HRS) were 'irresponsible'.

connections.description: Sacks is acting as legal counsel for Mr. Honig, authorized to make a settlement offer on his behalf.
Sacks is acting as legal counsel for Mrs. Wasserman, authorized to make a settlement offer on her behalf.
Sacks suggests Mr. Honig could provide valuable testimony against Abby Leigh in a potential case.
Andres Sanchez is married to Carmen Sanchez.
Carmen Sanchez is described as a staunch supporter of State Attorney Harry Lee Coe III.
Andres Sanchez is accused of sexually abusing his niece between 1987 and 1993.
Alexander stated the victim's recantation occurred after she was pressured by her aunt (Carmen Sanchez) and uncle.
Coe had a friendship with Carmen Sanchez, which created a conflict of interest leading to his office's removal from the Sanchez case.

events.title: Governor Orders Probe into Sanchez Case
events.description: Governor Lawton Chiles orders a criminal investigation into the handling of the Andres Sanchez child sex abuse case, following a grand jury's findings of political interference and shoddy work.

events.title: Grand Jury Charges Andres Sanchez
events.description: A Hillsborough County grand jury charges Andres Sanchez with seven counts of sexual battery.

events.title: First Report of Abuse
events.description: The victim first reports sexual abuse by Andres Sanchez to guidance counselor Valentine Munoz at Claywell Elementary School.

events.title: HRS Reports Abuse to Police
events.description: HRS reports the sexual abuse complaint to Tampa police after the victim repeats her allegations.

events.title: Criminal Report Sent to Coe's Office
events.description: Tampa police complete a criminal report affidavit charging sexual battery and send it to State Attorney Harry Lee Coe III's office for review.

events.title: Settlement Offer Email
events.description: Attorney Ira S. Sacks sends an email offering $150,000 to resolve a legal matter on behalf of Mr. Honig and Mrs. Wasserman, referencing a case against Abby Leigh.

locations: Virginia (mentioned as location of victim's grandmother)
keyFacts: A 2019 email shows attorney Ira S. Sacks offering a $150,000 settlement on behalf of clients Mr. Honig and Mrs. Wasserman, with implications about testimony in a case involving Abby Leigh.

A 1995 news article details Governor Lawton Chiles ordering a criminal probe into the handling of child sex abuse allegations against Andres Sanchez, citing political interference and a shoddy investigation.
Andres Sanchez was charged with seven counts of sexual battery against his niece, with abuse alleged to have occurred between 1987 and 1993.
The case involved alleged political pressure due to the friendship between State Attorney Harry Lee Coe III and the accused's wife, Democratic activist Carmen Sanchez.
The victim first reported the abuse in 1987, recanted under pressure from her aunt and uncle, and then repeated the allegations in 1993, leading to a delayed and controversial investigation.
